result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L. Hanson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Taylor Co. Case No. 16CF2

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Edward L. Hanson in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty places agreement on the record. DE enters a plea of no contest to Cts. 1 and 3.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists. Court finds plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently; accepted plea; finds DE guilty.  Court dismissed, but read in Cts. 2, 4, and 5.  Court imposed the following sentence on Ct. 1: 3.5 years in Wisconsin State Prison consisting of 1.5 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to 16CF2, with conditions of: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.   Court imposed the following sentence on Ct. 3: 4 years in Wisconsin State Prison consisting of 1 year initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to 16CF2 and concurrent to Ct. 1, with conditions of: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 273 days sentence credit. ba

for Edward L. Hanson Jr.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Arrest Report
Initial Appearance on February 9, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward L. Hanson, Jr. appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $3,000.00 cash bond booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders a $3,000.00 cash bond booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without valid prescription.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court orders clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in Case Nos. 15CF69, 15CF98 and 15CF102.  Next court date is February 9, 2016 at 1:00 pm - rt
